intro: Stachyphrynium longispicatum, commonly known as the long-spined stachyphrynium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in cymes. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
